etymology.description: Pictogram (象形) of a leg; similar to ⽦. See also 𠯣, pointing to 之 as a footprint.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a leg with the bend as the knee and the base as the foot, a straightforward image-to-meaning link. The reference to 之 as a footprint underscores its association with walking and feet.

examples.chinese: 他赤足走在沙滩上(他赤足走在沙灘上)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chìzú zǒu zài shātān shàng.
examples.english: He walked barefoot on the beach.

examples.chinese: 地上留下了很多足迹(地上留下了很多足跡)。
examples.pinyin: Dì shàng liú xià le hěn duō zújì.
examples.english: Many footprints were left on the ground.

examples.chinese: 医生检查他的足部(醫生檢查他的足部)。
